channel.description: Recent content on de Cat Hub

item.title: Car Suspension Problem
item.description: prematurely published draft The following problem is from a high-school-level physics puzzle book Gn√§dig, Honyek, and Riley (2001) (Problem #9): The suspension springs of all four wheels of a car are identical. By how much does the body of the car (considered rigid) rise above each of the wheels when its right front wheel is parked on an 8-cm-high pavement? Does the result change when the car is parked with both right wheels on the pavement?

item.title: About
item.description: Physics, statistics, and others. I am trying out this new blog site with the fantastic tool blogdown, for its LaTex support and R-friendliness – it is built on R Markdown. Contents from my old blog will be remastered (someday).
